page.title: 06CROPPING
page.content: The north western area of the quadrant has a heavier alluvial soil and produces cereals, potatoes and sugar beet. Southern and eastern area has a lighter alluvial soil and grows same crops as above area with addition of peas, beans and a full range of horticultural crops. With the demise of the local canning industry only one holding in the area produces top fruit and bush fruit on a commercial scale. Gooseberries were once a widely grown crop contracted to the local canning industry. Two units in the area have invested in glasshouses and produce brassicae transplants for other growers to buy and grow on.
